intro: Gundelia tenuisecta, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is a perennial herb that thrives in harsh, dry environments, showcasing remarkable adaptations to survive in extreme conditions. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, narrow leaves that reduce water loss through transpiration. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the cooler months. Gundelia tenuisecta is also noted for its ability to regenerate from its root system after periods of drought.
